step.tex: \int \left(2x^2 -3\sin x + 5\sqrt{x}\right)dx\\ \qquad\quad= 2\int x^2dx -3\int \sin x \,dx+ 5\int \sqrt{x}\,dx\\ \qquad\quad= 2 \dfrac{x^3}{3} - 3 \left(-\cos x\right) + 5 \dfrac{x^{\dfrac{3}{2}}}{\left(\dfrac{3}{2}\right)} + C\\ \qquad\quad= \dfrac{2}{3}x^3 + 3 \cos x + \dfrac{10}{3} x^{\dfrac{3}{2}} + C\\
step.reason: \text{We have used the fact that }\int x^{n}dx = \dfrac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} + C\\ \text{and }\int \sin x\,dx = -\cos x + C\text{ .Check your }\\ \text{calculation if you got something else.}\\
